title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 1000.3 - Exchange of information
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 1000.3 - Exchange of information

State Regulations

The Department of Labor shall, during each month, forward a
notice to all members of the Council of Contracting Agencies, stating the name, address and Federal identification number of each contractor determined by the
department, during the preceding monthly period, to have violated any provision
of article 8 or 9 of the Labor Law or the related regulations of the department
and describing the nature of such violation. Such notice shall indicate whether
the department has found such violation to be willful, and whether such
violation constitutes a second willful violation within a six-year period, subjecting the contractor to the debarment provisions of Labor Law, section
220-b(2)(b). In cases involving debarment, such notice shall further indicate
the beginning and ending dates of the five-year debarment period imposed by
that law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
1000.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
